title: [Patch 6.14] (2 Hidden Nerfs) Taliyah's W "Seismic Shove".
body:
I'm a Taliyah main, with most of my games on her, highest mastery, climbed to gold 3 with her. 

I understand Taliyah's nerfs on her E because of the no lockdown from W. That makes sense.

HOWEVER, there are 2 hidden nerfs on Taliyah's W ("Seismic Shove").

--------------------

1) It is slower than before, as the spell starts only after a direction has been chosen adding a human input delay. 

I remember the developer who originally designed this skill said that one of the reasons for W to have such a long pop up time was because the actual timer would start as soon as people clicked the skill. 

THIS IS NO LONGER TRUE. So now we are stuck with the old casting time + the human input delay.

 Considering your original purpose was to make her more accessible to more people, this change does exactly the opposite thing. If you don't believe me check for the % of times people actually land the W now compared to before.

--------------------

2) Max range casting is now very unreliable. It would never happen before with the old way, but now the ability can actually FIZZLE or make her walk before casting it.

This means that sometimes when casting it at max range it will fizzle out and i'm not even sure why it happens. I think it might be because I move out of range after i start the cast? 


--------------------

The solution I propose:

For SMART CASTING: Make the cast start as soon as you PRESS "W" wherever your mouse is at, in case the mouse is outside of the casting range make it cast it at **max range from Taliyah's current position**.

Basically having the cast start as soon as you press W at the mouse position (or closest to it in case of out of range) will remove the extra delay, releasing W will pick the direction towards where the mouse is pointing RELATIVE TO WHERE it was originally clicked at. this way people who want to pop up just have to tap it, while people who want to pop in a direction just have to press W, move mouse in the direction (past a certain buffer for the pop up version) release W.


For NORMAL CASTING: Make the cast start as soon as you CLICK the mouse. (the max range thing is not needed here because people actually want it to start where they are clicking it at)



PS: I actually play on the Japanese servers, so I have to use this low level account to be able to post on these forums.

replies.body:
Hi! 

You're spot on about both of these things: there is now a human input delay to how long it takes you to draw the arrow and release your mouse, and out of range casting is no longer clamped. These are both tradeoffs that come along with the concept of vector casting.

We could change these; arguably we could even do exactly what you propose (although clamping a vector cast is not trivial from a "read the player's intention" point of view: if you draw the arrow at an angle that's not 0 or 180 degrees and we transpose your origin point to be closer to you, do we transpose the displacement vector or do we adjust the angle such that the target still goes from the origin point to where you drew your arrow to? That is to say, do we conserve DIRECTION or TARGET POSITION? There is no correct answer here and either way someone would feel the game screwed them). This would be a decent amount of technical behind the scenes work (the game has a very limited number of targeting types and making a new one is a fair bit of work), but more importantly, one of the secondary goals of switching Taliyah W to vector cast has been to reduce the number of different spell casting paradigms in the game. My Taliyah 1.0 W casting paradigm was "vector casting but not really"; one of the big gains we made toward learnability of the game as a whole in 6.14 has been to reduce that down to just vector casting. If we did "vector casting but it's clamped and the delay starts with your first input" we'd be going back to "vector casting but not really".

You're also right in that this change makes Taliyah harder to learn and master, which was not our goal, but at this point we're talking about an overflowing sink on the Titanic. Sure that's a problem, but we've got much bigger problems that ALSO cause there to be some water damage. Between her Q, her R, and the pathing required to optimize P she's just a super hard champion to learn. I'd love for that to change, but there's always a hundred things you'd love to be the case for your champion, and in this case, wanting more players to be able to play and enjoy her *at all* was the more important consideration.

In summary, I hear you on your concerns and we will continue to listen and adjust as necessary. I think the W change has showed that when we're wrong, we'll admit we're wrong and fix things as best we can. Please continue trusting us that we have the best interests of our players in mind here.

I still think you were correct when you made the original Seismic Shove. It felt very intuitive and fun to use, but to me the change to vector casting makes her unplayable. Between the uncompensated extra cast time from input and how frequently you accidentally cancel the ability while trying to kite around I constantly felt like I was playing with a handicap.

What happened to defending your idea? You wrote an essay about why you chose the double click over vector casting and those of us that actually took the time to learn the ability agreed with you entirely. There are so many of us that are unhappy with this change and it really feels like you just gave in to those who never actually gave Taliyah a chance.
I agree with this; once I got used to the double click cast it was very intuitive and flowed very nicely with her kit.

"What happened to defending your idea?"

He got a ton of hate for defending his idea. Loads of downvotes on here and on Reddit, dozens/hundreds of upvotes on comments saying he was obsessed with his idea of the champion and classic "Rioters think they know what we want better than we do, god they're all such self-obsessed dicks!" bullshit.

He changed it because the vocal community was extremely convinced of being right and extremely rude about him disagreeing with them and defending his ideas. If he didn't change it he would have continued getting unfair attacks.

Riot as a whole has shown many, many times that they will stick to their opinions without budging an inch. I don't really understand why this is the one time it's different. Attacks from people too dense to actually try the ability shouldn't have been a factor.

Maybe because they want to show people that they are capable of listening to the community on things?

If you really think Riot are that unreasonable then why on Earth are you encouraging them to continue in that behaviour? You should be happy that they're showing they can pivot, even if this particular change is something you disagree with.

The original was far better.
Please just revert it.
Listening to the people who knew literally squat about her instead of her mains was an awful idea.
The ones who played her a lot figured out how to play with and become optimal with it.

Changes doesn't always have to make something easier.
Requiring actual skill and learning to be able to land a rewarding result well is good, and that should be what should be encouraged.
Not making them braindead and buggy instead and even worse.

pls just change it back ffs {{item:3070}}

I see, thank you for the reply. I also thought it had to do something around the homogenization of skills. It's certainly easier when they behave alike for several champions. 

I can't tell what would be a good solution if making spell cast start when W is pressed goes against the vector casting paradigm... I wish the timings could be adjusted accordingly but that might be even harder since 1) people have different mechanical skills, 2) reducing the cast time of the ability will make it more frustrating for enemies to evade. This is why i really support what would be a mix of the original design with vector casting.

About the max range issue, i think its not that subjective. A player is used to click and drag to define position + popping direction. So calculating the direction from the position of where the player clicked and dragged as if the spell was casted there, and then translating that direction to the max range would seem the most natural way. Put in other words, Taliyah's W has always felt (at least for me) as "start the seismic shove at a certain position, then make the shove go in "this direction" relative to where i started the shove". Kind of seeing the whole seismic shove as a live object. Which is the same principle of vector casting, a source point with a directional arrow relative to this source. Not a point that defines position, and another point that defines direction.

But anyways, thanks for replaying. I love Taliyah, and i really have to commend the designers for how possibility rich her skill set feels.

If you wanted people who enjoy taliyah for her kit and not her winrate, then reverting  the w is the solution. If you want people to only play her when shes overpowered, keep it as is. People loved taliyah for what she was, a fluid control mage. Shes not viktor, her playstyle doesnt match viktors, and she shouldnt be balanced around how another champian is played because people couldnt play her well their first game.

Is it possible to keep the old paradigm and just remove the self-silence, with compensating nerfs elsewhere?

Wouldn't that keep the good sides of the old paradigm, but remove the alleged "clunkyness" of the old self-silence that deterred most people from enjoying her?

If the main goal is to get more players to play Taliyah a change to how her w is cast and removal of the lock out isnt going to do it. Those changes are too small in the eyes of non Taliyah mains, if anything her pick rate is simply just going to dramatically drop. Most of the Taliyah mains, such as my self, don't even want to play her anymore. When people look at Taliyah, they expect her to be a hard champion to learn, making her "easier" won't do the trick. If you learn a hard champion you expect a good reward, like lots of damage or lots of cc, but with the nerfs when you finally manage to land a w the damage just feels lack luster. To much effort not enough reward. What would make her popular, is if you increase her damage but make it extremely hard to land. Example, what it was before.

I understand trying to keep the casting paradigm consistent. The issue here is that Taliyah's W does not function the same way the other vector cast skills do. It has a very small area of effect, with the directional input determining where the enemy goes after the skill activates rather than where the skill goes. This makes the skill very hard to land using vector casting (even for experienced players) when compared to the others (i.e. Equalizer, Death Ray). It also confuses newer players who are expecting the skill to travel in that direction, only to find that the directional input only matters if the enemy was in that small circle to begin with. I would suggest that at the very least, the initial cast should start the skill immediately (almost like the old way, but click-and-drag instead of double-click). That way, the skill can keep vector casting while allowing the player to react to how the placement of their W will affect the rest of their engagement.

Hi,
I have just a little something to share.

I fell in love with Taliyah's kit after 10 min. in my first game with her (on her release date), as she was the **funniest champ I had played**. Enough for me to get lvl 5 mastery on her in 2 or 3 days.

I stopped playing her so often, so that I wouldn't lose that feeling, and I didn't, until 2 hours ago, when I decided to play her again (support), thinking I would have a blast, even if I lost. Because **her kit makes her so fun to play whether you win or you lose**. Something that can't be said about many champions.

I read her changes, some days ago, but I didn't think they would be that bad. "_It's just one skill_" I thought...

The thing is, she didn't feel fun to play anymore. I couldn't kite at all, I couldn't provide my adc with the cc/peel he needed (not landing W would result in not being able to poke the enemies since they were both ranged and also great at kiting), but above all that:

**I didn't feel It was the same champ I fell in love with.**

Maybe that's an exageration, and I will try to improve with her if you keep her like this, but I highly doubt I will have as much fun with Taliyah.
Not because she is harder to play, but because her gameplay is no longer smooth, which (imo) was the best definition for her.

And I know, it was only one game, but I tried so hard to use the skill properly. I even "stopped playing" for a bit to train myself at using it.
Until I understood how it worked. But I still couldn't use it during a fight.

You probably didn't make the changes because you wanted to but because you had to.

But You, along with Shadowstorm and Iniquitee created her gamplay style.

I get it that you wanted her to be played by a wider range of people, and "that's why vector" but I also played viktor, rumble and whoever else used it, and I could play "old Taliyah" just fine after a while.
(There are some champs which gameplay fits really well with certain players and I guess that was the case with me back then.)

Again, it's ok if you want your creation to be appreciated by a wider range of people, and **no one can complain about that**, but my point is:
If you who created Taliyah doesn't like the change, or If you don't feel the same when you play a game with her, please, think about reverting it, regardless of what random people worldwide think about it.

And I am not disregarding how much thought you must have put into this. In the end I am just another random guy, player, selfishly making a request. :p

Sorry for the long post.

Best regards,

_Flynk Avalon_

Ps: It's 3 am here and I could really be doing something else, maybe useful, but I am worrying about a fictional character from a video game, and I might not even get profit out of it. How about that? xD

The new W results in me W'ing myself and the floor around me when I'm not even aiming it there. I don't know how to just knock a champion straight up in the air anymore. The W vector cast feels literally terrible, I have never had more problems landing one ability in the game more than this one. It makes no sense. It doesn't feel fluid. I've lost all confidence I have in playing this champion because of this change. How is that fair? Some people put in the work an the effort to learn this champion and now I don't even have fun playing her anymore. I don't even care about the damage nerfs, they are fine, nerf her damage if you have too. Just change her W back to the way it was cast. 

Obviously the person who designed this champion knew what they were doing, to go against HIS thoughts and change the way a spell works because of the community saying that she's hard to play and her W feels clunky, they do not know what they are talking about. Why did you not get in touch with people who have lots of games on her who can truly give you some honest feed back.

Yes the E-W combo was a lot of damage, nerf it if you need to, but what's the point in nerfing her damage if you can't land the W because of it's weird casting.

I'm sorry Riot, but this needs reverting, otherwise someone I and not only me, people who put a lot of effort into this champion, will no longer player her, because you wanted to please everybody. It's absolutely horrible to use and I hope you do something about it, or just delete her from the game because it's terrible.
